column2: Eldorado Gold Corp. engages in the mining, development and exploration of gold. The company is headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia and currently employs 2,756 full-time employees. The Companyâ€™s operations are classified into geographical segments that include Turkey, Canada, Brazil, Greece and Romania. The firm operates two gold mines in Turkey Kisladag and Efemcukuru, and two polymetallic mines in Greece Olympias and Stratoni. Its Stratoni mine is a silver-lead-zinc mine and the Olympias is a gold-silver-lead-zinc mine. The firm operates the Lamaque gold mine in Canada. The Brazil segment is engaged in operating Vila Nova, which is an iron ore mine, and is engaged in the exploration activties of Tocantinzinho project in Brazil. The firm is also developing Skouries and Perama Hill projects in Greece, and is developing Certej project in Romania.
